Name: Requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied by a photograph of the alleged violation.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied by a photograph of the alleged violation.
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1. Section 16-133 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision (f) to read as follows:
	f. All notices of violation issued by agents of the department to any person charged with a violation of any of the provisions of this title or any rules promulgated pursuant thereto shall contain a photograph evidencing the alleged violation, where feasible. A copy of each notice of violation served shall be filed and retained by the department, and shall be deemed a record kept in the ordinary course of business, and shall be prima  facie  evidence  of  the  facts  contained therein.
Â§ 2.  This local law shall take effect ninety days after its enactment. 
JJH - LS 517
Int. No. 926/2009
